home.title: Scholars of the South Tigris Solo Helper
home.play1: Play Scholars of the South Tigris solo against the AI.
home.play2: This application replaces scheme cards, manages most of the AI player board and guides you through the game and solo ruleset. It supports all difficulty levels.
home.play3: You can also play with the Body of Books expansion.

instructions.intro: Setup the game for a 2-player game, with the following changes for the AI:
instructions.soloBoard: Give your opponent the Solo Board instead of a Player Board.
instructions.influenceOrangeGuild: Place {count} Influence in the Orange Guild.
instructions.influencePurpleGuildScrollCard: Place {count} Influence on the Scroll Card in the Purple Guild.
instructions.influenceScrollCardNeutralMarker: Place {count} Influence on the Scroll Card adjacent to the Neutral Marker.
instructions.goldOnLeftMostTranslatorCount: Place 1 Gold on the left-most neutral Translator. | Place 1 Gold on each of the 2 left-most neutral Translators.
instructions.startingScrollCard: They start with a random {language} Scroll Card from the reserve. Place it facedown above the associated language as printed across the top of the Solo Board, without any further effect.
instructions.researchMarkers: Rather than placing their Research Markers on the Main Board, keep them nearby the Solo Board.
instructions.researchMarkersBodyOfBooks: Place your opponentâ€™s Research Markers on the Main Board Extension. Each Research Marker should be placed directly below a different Page Card.
instructions.noSchemeCards: The AI does not need the action cards or scheme cards - the scheme card deck and the "Dice Sum" track is managed by this application.
instructions.xpFirstCaliphSpace: Place only 1 XP on the first Caliph Card space.
instructions.firstPlayerMarker: Give yourself the First Player Marker. You can play either the Casual or Epic version of the game.
instructions.noFurtherSetup: Do not give your opponent any other player components. They do not select a Starting Translator or Resource Card. Instead, all Neutral Translators belong to your opponent, but there is no need to place Influence on them.
